skill.name: pdf-processing
skill.description: Extract text and tables from PDF files, fill forms, merge documents. Use when working with PDF files or when the user mentions PDFs, forms, or document extraction.
skill.summary: Extract text and tables from PDF files, fill forms, merge documents. Use when working with PDF files...
skill.author: 0xkynz

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. The SKILL.md provides AI instructions for PDF processing using standard libraries like pdfplumber and PyPDF2. No scripts, network calls, or concerning capabilities detected.

content.value_statement: PDF documents contain valuable data that is difficult to access programmatically. This skill provides AI agents with the capabilities to extract text, tables, and form data from PDFs, and to manipulate documents through merging, splitting, and formatting operations.
actual_capabilities: Extract text from single or multiple PDF pages
Identify and extract tables from PDF documents
Fill PDF forms with data programmatically
Merge multiple PDFs into a single document
Rotate pages and add watermarks to PDFs
limitations: Requires external Python libraries (pdfplumber, PyPDF2, pypdf)
Cannot process password-protected PDFs without decryption
Scanned documents require OCR for text extraction
Complex table layouts may need manual verification

use_cases.title: Extract structured data
use_cases.description: Pull tables and data from PDF reports for analysis in spreadsheets or databases

use_cases.title: Automate form workflows
use_cases.description: Fill out PDF forms programmatically and process form submission data

use_cases.title: Build PDF automation
use_cases.description: Integrate PDF processing into larger document management pipelines

prompt_templates.title: Extract all text
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract all text content from the PDF file at [file_path]. Preserve paragraph structure and headings.

prompt_templates.title: Extract tables to CSV
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all tables in [file_path] and convert them to CSV format. Save each table as a separate file.

prompt_templates.title: Fill PDF form
prompt_templates.prompt: Fill the PDF form at [form_path] with the following data: [key-value pairs]. Save the completed form to [output_path].

prompt_templates.title: Merge and process
prompt_templates.prompt: Merge all PDF files in [source_directory] into a single document. Add a header page and page numbers to each page. Save to [output_path].

output_examples.input: Extract all text and tables from the quarterly report PDF
output: Saved tables as CSV files: table_1.csv through table_8.csv
Text saved to quarterly_report.txt (preserved headings and structure)

best_practices: Check if PDFs are encrypted before attempting to process them
Use OCR (pytesseract) for scanned documents to enable text extraction
Validate extracted table data after extraction for accuracy
anti_patterns: Attempting to extract text from scanned PDFs without OCR preprocessing
Processing large PDFs without pagination or chunking
Ignoring PDF form field types when filling forms

faq.question: What PDF libraries does this skill use?
faq.answer: The skill uses pdfplumber for text and table extraction, and PyPDF2 or pypdf for document manipulation like merging and splitting.

faq.question: Can this skill process scanned PDFs?
faq.answer: Scanned PDFs contain images rather than text. You will need to use OCR (pytesseract) to extract text from scanned documents.

faq.question: What file sizes are supported?
faq.answer: PDF processing is memory-dependent. Files under 100MB work reliably. Very large files may require streaming or chunked processing.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with my codebase?
faq.answer: Import the required libraries in your Python code. The skill provides example patterns for common operations like extraction and form filling.

faq.question: Is my data safe when processing PDFs?
faq.answer: All processing happens locally when you run the code. No data is sent to external servers. Ensure PDF files are from trusted sources.

faq.question: How is this different from online PDF tools?
faq.answer: This skill runs locally in your environment, keeping sensitive documents private. It also integrates into automated workflows and can process many files programmatically.
